general_requirements.statewide_program_name: Minnesota offers SolarAPP+ permitting incentive program through Dept of Commerce. Provides financial incentives and technical assistance to jurisdictions adopting SolarAPP+ automated permitting.

interconnection.net_metering_details: Minnesota has net metering for systems up to 1 MW. Credits at retail rate for systems up to 40 kW residential. Xcel Energy (Northern States Power) is the largest utility and offers Solar*Rewards and community solar programs. Monthly rollover, annual true-up.
interconnection.fees: Xcel Energy: minimal for residential; application fee varies for commercial

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: Minnesota has a solar access law (Minn. Stat. 500.30). Solar easements protected. HOAs cannot unreasonably restrict solar installations.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Historic districts in Minneapolis, St. Paul, and other cities. Minnesota SHPO reviews solar in National Register districts.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Standard IBC wind load requirements. Open prairie areas may have enhanced wind considerations. Design wind speeds typically 90-110 mph.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Significant snow loads throughout the state (30-70 psf ground snow load). Northern Minnesota has the highest requirements. Structural engineer certification required for structural system support including snow-drift loads and firefighter live loads.

licensing.license_type: Licensed electrician required for PV installations. Type A Master Electrician or Journeyman Electrician under master's supervision. Building contractor license for structural work.

notes: Minnesota is a strong solar market with favorable net metering, community solar programs (one of the largest in the nation), and SolarAPP+ adoption incentives. Xcel Energy's Solar*Rewards program provides additional production-based incentives. The Made in Minnesota Solar Incentive Program promoted domestic manufacturing. Property tax exemption available. Snow loads are a critical engineering consideration requiring structural certification. The state has a 1.5% solar energy standard within its 25% RPS.
